head: Permanent votersâ€™ cards (PVCs) and smart card readers were introduced for the 2015 national elections in order to enhance transparency and prevent fraud. However, during setup of polling units in 2015, only 77% of polling units in Nigeria had functioning card readers.

At 21% of polling units in 2015, particularly in northern states, voters were accredited to vote without their PVCs being checked by the card reader. Additionally, at 48% of polling units, voters were accredited even though the card reader could not read their PVC.
sub: [map of accreditation without card reader in 2015]

head: In state elections since 2015, functioning card readers were not uniform across LGAs. However, their use has generally improved since the 2015 elections.
